result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavon Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 03-01-2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shavon Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received July 22, 2016,   Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: January 25, 2016
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shavon  Jackson in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Murray makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
FINE: $505.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/1/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Shavon Jackson in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Murray moves for adjournment to complete paperwork.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court.   Defendant Shavon  Jackson did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Murray states he does not know why his client does not appear today. Court will revoke and forfeit bail. Warrant amount is $500.00.

Case re-called at 2:25pm, Defendant now appears. Court will vacate previous order for forfeiture and warrant. Court will set for plea and sentencing. Plea/sentencing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 3:00 pm.

Attorney Murray advises his client called him and said she could not get a ride to court.  Court adjourns this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
